title: Amazon Spring Sale deals on Verge staff favorites

title: Amazon’s big spring sale continues, and we found the 100 best deals

title: I’m still testing the new Razer Blade 16 and I have mixed feelings

title: BougeRV’s telescopic lantern is ridiculously versatile
snippets: BougeRV's LED lantern, marketed as an outdoor light, is a versatile, rechargeable work lamp offering 3000 lumens of brightness through three adjustable LED panels. It's designed for various settings, including campsites, workspaces, and more, due to its compact size and functionality as a flashlight.
summary: BougeRV has released a LED lantern designed for outdoor use, featuring 3000 lumens of brightness with three adjustable LED panels. This versatile, rechargeable lamp is suitable for various settings such as campsites and workspaces, and can also function as a flashlight due to its compact size.

title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction preventing the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) during ongoing legal proceedings.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction that stops the Trump administration and the Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) while legal proceedings are ongoing.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account

summary: Microsoft will eliminate a bypass script in the latest Windows 11 Insider Preview, which previously let users set up the system without an internet connection or a Microsoft account.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X, previously known as Twitter, in an all-stock deal. Musk, who bought Twitter a few years ago for $44 billion, announced the transaction values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, which includes $12 billion in debt.
summary: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has purchased the social media platform X (formerly Twitter) in an all-stock transaction. Musk, who previously acquired Twitter for $44 billion, values xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, with the deal incorporating $12 billion of debt.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653), a feature aimed at enabling IT professionals to remotely recover Windows 11 devices that won't boot. This development comes as a response to prevent incidents similar to the previous year's Crowdstrike catastrophe.
summary: Microsoft is testing a new feature called Quick Machine Recovery in the latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11. This tool is designed to help IT professionals remotely recover devices that cannot boot, a move to prevent issues like last year's Crowdstrike incident.

title: Researchers identify mutations that can lead to resistance to some chemotherapies
snippets: Researchers have discovered that mutations in VPS35, a crucial element in a pathway that uses reactive oxygen species (ROS) to destroy cancer cells, may lead to chemotherapy resistance in some cancers. This finding could aid in identifying tumors that are resistant to treatment.
summary: Researchers have found that mutations in VPS35, a key component in a pathway that employs reactive oxygen species (ROS) to eliminate cancer cells, may cause some cancers to resist chemotherapy. This discovery could help identify tumors that are resistant to treatment.

title: Discrimination-related depression, anxiety pronounced among multiracial, White, Asian populations
snippets: A study reveals that over 50% of US adults have faced discrimination, significantly impacting mental health. Those highly exposed to discrimination are over five times more likely to show signs of depression and anxiety. Adults experiencing such mistreatment have almost nine times higher odds of screening positive for both mental health conditions compared to those without such experiences.
summary: A study indicates that over half of US adults have encountered discrimination, which greatly affects their mental health. Individuals highly exposed to discrimination are more than five times as likely to exhibit depression and anxiety symptoms. Furthermore, adults facing mistreatment have nearly nine times higher chances of testing positive for both mental health issues compared to those who have not experienced discrimination.

title: Meniscus injuries may soon be treated by customizable hydrogel
snippets: A new 3D printed hydrogel designed for treating various types of meniscal tears showed promising results in preclinical trials. This customizable hydrogel could potentially offer a tailored solution for individuals with knee injuries.
summary: A new customizable 3D printed hydrogel has shown promise in preclinical trials for treating different types of meniscal tears in the knee. This advancement could provide personalized treatment options for those with knee injuries.

title: Cold plunges actually change your cells
snippets: A study found that immersing in cold water for seven days boosts cellular resilience and autophagic function, enhancing cells' ability to handle stress. This adaptation may improve health, prevent diseases, and slow aging at the cellular level.
summary: A study discovered that seven days of cold water immersion enhances cellular resilience and autophagic function, which helps cells manage stress better. This adaptation could potentially improve overall health, prevent diseases, and decelerate aging at the cellular level.

title: Researchers develop new DNA test for personalized treatment of bacterial vaginosis
snippets: Around one-third of women aged 14-49 in the US experience bacterial vaginosis (BV), marked by odors and discomfort, with over half not responding to initial antibiotic treatment. Researchers have now created a DNA PCR-based lab test to improve treatment by identifying the specific bacteria causing BV, aiming to enhance prescription accuracy for patients.
summary: Researchers have developed a DNA PCR-based lab test aimed at improving the treatment of bacterial vaginosis (BV), a condition affecting one-third of US women aged 14-49. The test identifies the specific bacteria responsible for BV, which is characterized by odors and discomfort. This innovation could lead to more accurate prescriptions for the over half of patients who do not respond to initial antibiotic treatments.

title: Why scientists are worried about weasels
snippets: Researchers discovered that red meat, enhanced with scent oils, is the most effective bait for capturing weasel images on camera traps. This finding is crucial for conservationists who struggle to monitor weasel populations due to their elusive nature.
summary: Researchers found that red meat treated with scent oils is the best bait for photographing weasels on camera traps. This discovery is important for conservationists aiming to monitor the hard-to-detect weasel populations effectively.

title: Artificial neurons organize themselves
snippets: Researchers have developed novel artificial neurons that can learn independently, closely mirroring biological neurons. These 'infomorphic neurons' form artificial neural networks that self-organize and adapt by gathering information from their network environment.
summary: Researchers have created new artificial neurons, named 'infomorphic neurons', that can independently learn and adapt, similar to human neurons. These neurons form networks that self-organize by collecting information from their surroundings.
